00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/obdclass/llog.c
00037  *
00038  * OST<->MDS recovery logging infrastructure.
00039  * Invariants in implementation:
00040  * - we do not share logs among different OST<->MDS connections, so that
00041  *   if an OST or MDS fails it need only look at log(s) relevant to itself
00042  *
00043  * Author: Andreas Dilger <adilger@clusterfs.com>
00044  * Author: Alex Zhuravlev <bzzz@whamcloud.com>
00045  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <tappro@whamcloud.com>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LOG
00049 
00050 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00051 #include <llog_swab.h>
00052 #include <lustre_log.h>
00053 #include <obd_class.h>
00054 #include "llog_internal.h"
00055 /*
00056  * Allocate a new log or catalog handle
00057  * Used inside llog_open().
00058  */
00059 static struct llog_handle *llog_alloc_handle(void)
00060 {
00061         struct llog_handle *loghandle;
00062 
00063         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(loghandle);
00064         if (loghandle == NULL)
00065                 return NULL;
00066 
00067         init_rwsem(&loghandle->lgh_lock);
00068         mutex_init(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00069         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&loghandle->u.phd.phd_entry);
00070         atomic_set(&loghandle->lgh_refcount, 1);
00071 
00072         return loghandle;
00073 }
00074 
00075 /*
00076  * Free llog handle and header data if exists. Used in llog_close() only
00077  */
00078 static void llog_free_handle(struct llog_handle *loghandle)
00079 {
00080         LASSERT(loghandle != NULL);
00081 
00082         /* failed llog_init_handle */
00083         if (loghandle->lgh_hdr == NULL)
00084                 goto out;
00085 
00086         if (loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN)
00087                 LASSERT(list_empty(&loghandle->u.phd.phd_entry));
00088         else if (loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT)
00089                 LASSERT(list_empty(&loghandle->u.chd.chd_head));
00090         OBD_FREE_LARGE(loghandle->lgh_hdr, loghandle->lgh_hdr_size);
00091 out:
00092         OBD_FREE_PTR(loghandle);
00093 }
00094 
00095 void llog_handle_get(struct llog_handle *loghandle)
00096 {
00097         atomic_inc(&loghandle->lgh_refcount);
00098 }
00099 
00100 void llog_handle_put(struct llog_handle *loghandle)
00101 {
00102         LASSERT(atomic_read(&loghandle->lgh_refcount) > 0);
00103         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&loghandle->lgh_refcount))
00104                 llog_free_handle(loghandle);
00105 }
00106 
00107 static int llog_declare_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
00108                                 struct llog_handle *handle,
00109                                 struct thandle *th)
00110 {
00111         struct llog_operations *lop;
00112         int rc;
00113 
00114         ENTRY;
00115 
00116         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00117         if (rc)
00118                 RETURN(rc);
00119         if (lop->lop_declare_destroy == NULL)
00120                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00121 
00122         rc = lop->lop_declare_destroy(env, handle, th);
00123 
00124         RETURN(rc);
00125 }
00126 
00127 int llog_trans_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,
00128                        struct thandle *th)
00129 {
00130         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00131         int rc;
00132         ENTRY;
00133 
00134         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00135         if (rc < 0)
00136                 RETURN(rc);
00137         if (lop->lop_destroy == NULL)
00138                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00139 
00140         LASSERT(handle->lgh_obj != NULL);
00141         if (!dt_object_exists(handle->lgh_obj))
00142                 RETURN(0);
00143 
00144         rc = lop->lop_destroy(env, handle, th);
00145 
00146         RETURN(rc);
00147 }
00148 
00149 int llog_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle)
00150 {
00151         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00152         struct dt_device        *dt;
00153         struct thandle          *th;
00154         int rc;
00155 
00156         ENTRY;
00157 
00158         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00159         if (rc < 0)
00160                 RETURN(rc);
00161         if (lop->lop_destroy == NULL)
00162                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00163 
00164         if (handle->lgh_obj == NULL) {
00165                 /* if lgh_obj == NULL, then it is from client side destroy */
00166                 rc = lop->lop_destroy(env, handle, NULL);
00167                 RETURN(rc);
00168         }
00169 
00170         if (!dt_object_exists(handle->lgh_obj))
00171                 RETURN(0);
00172 
00173         dt = lu2dt_dev(handle->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
00174 
00175         th = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
00176         if (IS_ERR(th))
00177                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00178 
00179         rc = llog_declare_destroy(env, handle, th);
00180         if (rc != 0)
00181                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
00182 
00183         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, th);
00184         if (rc < 0)
00185                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
00186 
00187         rc = lop->lop_destroy(env, handle, th);
00188 
00189 out_trans:
00190         dt_trans_stop(env, dt, th);
00191 
00192         RETURN(rc);
00193 }
00194 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_destroy);
00195 
00196 /* returns negative on error; 0 if success; 1 if success & log destroyed */
00197 int llog_cancel_rec(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *loghandle,
00198                     int index)
00199 {
00200         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00201         struct dt_device        *dt;
00202         struct llog_log_hdr     *llh = loghandle->lgh_hdr;
00203         struct thandle          *th;
00204         int                      rc;
00205         int rc1;
00206         bool subtract_count = false;
00207 
00208         ENTRY;
00209 
00210         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "Canceling %d in log "DOSTID"\n", index,
00211                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi));
00212 
00213         if (index == 0) {
00214                 CERROR("Can't cancel index 0 which is header\n");
00215                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00216         }
00217 
00218         LASSERT(loghandle != NULL);
00219         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_ctxt != NULL);
00220         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_obj != NULL);
00221 
00222         dt = lu2dt_dev(loghandle->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
00223 
00224         th = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
00225         if (IS_ERR(th))
00226                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00227 
00228         rc = llog_declare_write_rec(env, loghandle, &llh->llh_hdr, index, th);
00229         if (rc < 0)
00230                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
00231 
00232         if ((llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_ZAP_WHEN_EMPTY))
00233                 rc = llog_declare_destroy(env, loghandle, th);
00234 
00235         th->th_wait_submit = 1;
00236         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, th);
00237         if (rc < 0)
00238                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
00239 
00240         down_write(&loghandle->lgh_lock);
00241         /* clear bitmap */
00242         mutex_lock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00243         if (!ext2_clear_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh))) {
00244                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "Catalog index %u already clear?\n", index);
00245                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00246         }
00247 
00248         loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_count--;
00249         subtract_count = true;
00250         /* Pass this index to llog_osd_write_rec(), which will use the index
00251          * to only update the necesary bitmap. */
00252         lgi->lgi_cookie.lgc_index = index;
00253         /* update header */
00254         rc = llog_write_rec(env, loghandle, &llh->llh_hdr, &lgi->lgi_cookie,
00255                             LLOG_HEADER_IDX, th);
00256         if (rc != 0)
00257                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00258 
00259         if ((llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_ZAP_WHEN_EMPTY) &&
00260             (llh->llh_count == 1) &&
00261             ((loghandle->lgh_last_idx == LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh) - 1) ||
00262              (loghandle->u.phd.phd_cat_handle != NULL &&
00263               loghandle->u.phd.phd_cat_handle->u.chd.chd_current_log !=
00264                 loghandle))) {
00265                 /* never try to destroy it again */
00266                 llh->llh_flags &= ~LLOG_F_ZAP_WHEN_EMPTY;
00267                 rc = llog_trans_destroy(env, loghandle, th);
00268                 if (rc < 0) {
00269                         /* Sigh, can not destroy the final plain llog, but
00270                          * the bitmap has been clearly, so the record can not
00271                          * be accessed anymore, let's return 0 for now, and
00272                          * the orphan will be handled by LFSCK. */
00273                         CERROR("%s: can't destroy empty llog #"DOSTID
00274                                "#%08x: rc = %d\n",
00275                                loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name,
00276                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
00277                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, rc);
00278                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00279                 }
00280                 rc = LLOG_DEL_PLAIN;
00281         }
00282 
00283 out_unlock:
00284         mutex_unlock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00285         up_write(&loghandle->lgh_lock);
00286 out_trans:
00287         rc1 = dt_trans_stop(env, dt, th);
00288         if (rc == 0)
00289                 rc = rc1;
00290         if (rc < 0 && subtract_count) {
00291                 mutex_lock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00292                 loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_count++;
00293                 ext2_set_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh));
00294                 mutex_unlock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00295         }
00296         RETURN(rc);
00297 }
00298 
00299 int llog_read_header(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,
00300                      const struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00301 {
00302         struct llog_operations *lop;
00303         int rc;
00304         ENTRY;
00305 
00306         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00307         if (rc)
00308                 RETURN(rc);
00309 
00310         if (lop->lop_read_header == NULL)
00311                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00312 
00313         rc = lop->lop_read_header(env, handle);
00314         if (rc == LLOG_EEMPTY) {
00315                 struct llog_log_hdr *llh = handle->lgh_hdr;
00316 
00317                 /* lrh_len should be initialized in llog_init_handle */
00318                 handle->lgh_last_idx = 0; /* header is record with index 0 */
00319                 handle->lgh_write_offset = 0;
00320                 llh->llh_count = 1;         /* for the header record */
00321                 llh->llh_hdr.lrh_type = LLOG_HDR_MAGIC;
00322                 LASSERT(handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_chunk_size >=
00323                                                 LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE);
00324                 llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len = handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_chunk_size;
00325                 llh->llh_hdr.lrh_index = 0;
00326                 llh->llh_timestamp = cfs_time_current_sec();
00327                 if (uuid)
00328                         memcpy(&llh->llh_tgtuuid, uuid,
00329                                sizeof(llh->llh_tgtuuid));
00330                 llh->llh_bitmap_offset = offsetof(typeof(*llh), llh_bitmap);
00331                 /* Since update llog header might also call this function,
00332                  * let's reset the bitmap to 0 here */
00333                 memset(LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh), 0, llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len -
00334                                                 llh->llh_bitmap_offset -
00335                                                 sizeof(llh->llh_tail));
00336                 ext2_set_bit(0, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh));
00337                 LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh)->lrt_len = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00338                 LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh)->lrt_index = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_index;
00339                 rc = 0;
00340         }
00341         RETURN(rc);
00342 }
00343 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_read_header);
00344 
00345 int llog_init_handle(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,
00346                      int flags, struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00347 {
00348         struct llog_log_hdr     *llh;
00349         enum llog_flag           fmt = flags & LLOG_F_EXT_MASK;
00350         int                      rc;
00351         int                     chunk_size = handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_chunk_size;
00352         ENTRY;
00353 
00354         LASSERT(handle->lgh_hdr == NULL);
00355 
00356         LASSERT(chunk_size >= LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE);
00357         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(llh, chunk_size);
00358         if (llh == NULL)
00359                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00360 
00361         handle->lgh_hdr = llh;
00362         handle->lgh_hdr_size = chunk_size;
00363         /* first assign flags to use llog_client_ops */
00364         llh->llh_flags = flags;
00365         rc = llog_read_header(env, handle, uuid);
00366         if (rc == 0) {
00367                 if (unlikely((llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN &&
00368                               flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT) ||
00369                              (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT &&
00370                               flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN))) {
00371                         CERROR("%s: llog type is %s but initializing %s\n",
00372                                handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name,
00373                                llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT ?
00374                                "catalog" : "plain",
00375                                flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT ? "catalog" : "plain");
00376                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00377                 } else if (llh->llh_flags &
00378                            (LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN | LLOG_F_IS_CAT)) {
00379                         /*
00380                          * it is possible to open llog without specifying llog
00381                          * type so it is taken from llh_flags
00382                          */
00383                         flags = llh->llh_flags;
00384                 } else {
00385                         /* for some reason the llh_flags has no type set */
00386                         CERROR("llog type is not specified!\n");
00387                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00388                 }
00389                 if (unlikely(uuid &&
00390                              !obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &llh->llh_tgtuuid))) {
00391                         CERROR("%s: llog uuid mismatch: %s/%s\n",
00392                                handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name,
00393                                (char *)uuid->uuid,
00394                                (char *)llh->llh_tgtuuid.uuid);
00395                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00396                 }
00397         }
00398         if (flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT) {
00399                 LASSERT(list_empty(&handle->u.chd.chd_head));
00400                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&handle->u.chd.chd_head);
00401                 llh->llh_size = sizeof(struct llog_logid_rec);
00402                 llh->llh_flags |= LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE;
00403         } else if (!(flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN)) {
00404                 CERROR("%s: unknown flags: %#x (expected %#x or %#x)\n",
00405                        handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name,
00406                        flags, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN);
00407                 rc = -EINVAL;
00408         }
00409         llh->llh_flags |= fmt;
00410 out:
00411         if (rc) {
00412                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(llh, chunk_size);
00413                 handle->lgh_hdr = NULL;
00414         }
00415         RETURN(rc);
00416 }
00417 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_init_handle);
00418 
00419 static int llog_process_thread(void *arg)
00420 {
00421         struct llog_process_info        *lpi = arg;
00422         struct llog_handle              *loghandle = lpi->lpi_loghandle;
00423         struct llog_log_hdr             *llh = loghandle->lgh_hdr;
00424         struct llog_process_cat_data    *cd  = lpi->lpi_catdata;
00425         char                            *buf;
00426         size_t                           chunk_size;
00427         __u64                            cur_offset, tmp_offset;
00428         int                              rc = 0, index = 1, last_index;
00429         int                              saved_index = 0;
00430         int                              last_called_index = 0;
00431 
00432         ENTRY;
00433 
00434         if (llh == NULL)
00435                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00436 
00437         cur_offset = chunk_size = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00438         /* expect chunk_size to be power of two */
00439         LASSERT(is_power_of_2(chunk_size));
00440 
00441         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(buf, chunk_size);
00442         if (buf == NULL) {
00443                 lpi->lpi_rc = -ENOMEM;
00444                 RETURN(0);
00445         }
00446 
00447         if (cd != NULL) {
00448                 last_called_index = cd->lpcd_first_idx;
00449                 index = cd->lpcd_first_idx + 1;
00450         }
00451         if (cd != NULL && cd->lpcd_last_idx)
00452                 last_index = cd->lpcd_last_idx;
00453         else
00454                 last_index = LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh) - 1;
00455 
00456         while (rc == 0) {
00457                 struct llog_rec_hdr *rec;
00458                 off_t chunk_offset;
00459                 unsigned int buf_offset = 0;
00460                 bool partial_chunk;
00461 
00462                 /* skip records not set in bitmap */
00463                 while (index <= last_index &&
00464                        !ext2_test_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh)))
00465                         ++index;
00466 
00467                 /* There are no indices prior the last_index */
00468                 if (index > last_index)
00469                         break;
00470 
00471                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "index: %d last_index %d\n", index,
00472                        last_index);
00473 
00474 repeat:
00475                 /* get the buf with our target record; avoid old garbage */
00476                 memset(buf, 0, chunk_size);
00477                 rc = llog_next_block(lpi->lpi_env, loghandle, &saved_index,
00478                                      index, &cur_offset, buf, chunk_size);
00479                 if (rc != 0)
00480                         GOTO(out, rc);
00481 
00482                 /* NB: after llog_next_block() call the cur_offset is the
00483                  * offset of the next block after read one.
00484                  * The absolute offset of the current chunk is calculated
00485                  * from cur_offset value and stored in chunk_offset variable.
00486                  */
00487                 tmp_offset = cur_offset;
00488                 if (do_div(tmp_offset, chunk_size) != 0) {
00489                         partial_chunk = true;
00490                         chunk_offset = cur_offset & ~(chunk_size - 1);
00491                 } else {
00492                         partial_chunk = false;
00493                         chunk_offset = cur_offset - chunk_size;
00494                 }
00495 
00496                 /* NB: when rec->lrh_len is accessed it is already swabbed
00497                  * since it is used at the "end" of the loop and the rec
00498                  * swabbing is done at the beginning of the loop. */
00499                 for (rec = (struct llog_rec_hdr *)(buf + buf_offset);
00500                      (char *)rec < buf + chunk_size;
00501                      rec = llog_rec_hdr_next(rec)) {
00502 
00503                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "processing rec 0x%p type %#x\n",
00504                                rec, rec->lrh_type);
00505 
00506                         if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(rec))
00507                                 lustre_swab_llog_rec(rec);
00508 
00509                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "after swabbing, type=%#x idx=%d\n",
00510                                rec->lrh_type, rec->lrh_index);
00511 
00512                         /* for partial chunk the end of it is zeroed, check
00513                          * for index 0 to distinguish it. */
00514                         if (partial_chunk && rec->lrh_index == 0) {
00515                                 /* concurrent llog_add() might add new records
00516                                  * while llog_processing, check this is not
00517                                  * the case and re-read the current chunk
00518                                  * otherwise. */
00519                                 if (index > loghandle->lgh_last_idx)
00520                                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00521                                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "Re-read last llog buffer for "
00522                                        "new records, index %u, last %u\n",
00523                                        index, loghandle->lgh_last_idx);
00524                                 /* save offset inside buffer for the re-read */
00525                                 buf_offset = (char *)rec - (char *)buf;
00526                                 cur_offset = chunk_offset;
00527                                 goto repeat;
00528                         }
00529 
00530                         if (rec->lrh_len == 0 || rec->lrh_len > chunk_size) {
00531                                 CWARN("invalid length %d in llog record for "
00532                                       "index %d/%d\n", rec->lrh_len,
00533                                       rec->lrh_index, index);
00534                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00535                         }
00536 
00537                         if (rec->lrh_index < index) {
00538                                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "skipping lrh_index %d\n",
00539                                        rec->lrh_index);
00540                                 continue;
00541                         }
00542 
00543                         if (rec->lrh_index != index) {
00544                                 CERROR("%s: Invalid record: index %u but "
00545                                        "expected %u\n",
00546                                        loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name,
00547                                        rec->lrh_index, index);
00548                                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
00549                         }
00550 
00551                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER,
00552                                "lrh_index: %d lrh_len: %d (%d remains)\n",
00553                                rec->lrh_index, rec->lrh_len,
00554                                (int)(buf + chunk_size - (char *)rec));
00555 
00556                         loghandle->lgh_cur_idx = rec->lrh_index;
00557                         loghandle->lgh_cur_offset = (char *)rec - (char *)buf +
00558                                                     chunk_offset;
00559 
00560                         /* if set, process the callback on this record */
00561                         if (ext2_test_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh))) {
00562                                 rc = lpi->lpi_cb(lpi->lpi_env, loghandle, rec,
00563                                                  lpi->lpi_cbdata);
00564                                 last_called_index = index;
00565                                 if (rc == LLOG_PROC_BREAK) {
00566                                         GOTO(out, rc);
00567                                 } else if (rc == LLOG_DEL_RECORD) {
00568                                         rc = llog_cancel_rec(lpi->lpi_env,
00569                                                              loghandle,
00570                                                              rec->lrh_index);
00571                                 }
00572                                 if (rc)
00573                                         GOTO(out, rc);
00574                         }
00575                         /* exit if the last index is reached */
00576                         if (index >= last_index)
00577                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00578                         ++index;
00579                 }
00580         }
00581 
00582 out:
00583         if (cd != NULL)
00584                 cd->lpcd_last_idx = last_called_index;
00585 
00586         if (unlikely(rc == -EIO && loghandle->lgh_obj != NULL)) {
00587                 if (dt_object_remote(loghandle->lgh_obj)) {
00588                         /* If it is remote object, then -EIO might means
00589                          * disconnection or eviction, let's return -EAGAIN,
00590                          * so for update recovery log processing, it will
00591                          * retry until the umount or abort recovery, see
00592                          * lod_sub_recovery_thread() */
00593                         CERROR("%s retry remote llog process\n",
00594                                loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name);
00595                         rc = -EAGAIN;
00596                 } else {
00597                         /* something bad happened to the processing of a local
00598                          * llog file, probably I/O error or the log got
00599                          * corrupted to be able to finally release the log we
00600                          * discard any remaining bits in the header */
00601                         CERROR("Local llog found corrupted\n");
00602                         while (index <= last_index) {
00603                                 if (ext2_test_bit(index,
00604                                                   LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh)) != 0)
00605                                         llog_cancel_rec(lpi->lpi_env, loghandle,
00606                                                         index);
00607                                 index++;
00608                         }
00609                         rc = 0;
00610                 }
00611         }
00612 
00613         OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf, chunk_size);
00614         lpi->lpi_rc = rc;
00615         return 0;
00616 }
00617 
00618 static int llog_process_thread_daemonize(void *arg)
00619 {
00620         struct llog_process_info        *lpi = arg;
00621         struct lu_env                    env;
00622         int                              rc;
00623 
00624         unshare_fs_struct();
00625 
00626         /* client env has no keys, tags is just 0 */
00627         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL | LCT_MG_THREAD);
00628         if (rc)
00629                 goto out;
00630         lpi->lpi_env = &env;
00631 
00632         rc = llog_process_thread(arg);
00633 
00634         lu_env_fini(&env);
00635 out:
00636         complete(&lpi->lpi_completion);
00637         return rc;
00638 }
00639 
00640 int llog_process_or_fork(const struct lu_env *env,
00641                          struct llog_handle *loghandle,
00642                          llog_cb_t cb, void *data, void *catdata, bool fork)
00643 {
00644         struct llog_process_info *lpi;
00645         int                      rc;
00646 
00647         ENTRY;
00648 
00649         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lpi);
00650         if (lpi == NULL) {
00651                 CERROR("cannot alloc pointer\n");
00652                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00653         }
00654         lpi->lpi_loghandle = loghandle;
00655         lpi->lpi_cb        = cb;
00656         lpi->lpi_cbdata    = data;
00657         lpi->lpi_catdata   = catdata;
00658 
00659         if (fork) {
00660                 struct task_struct *task;
00661 
00662                 /* The new thread can't use parent env,
00663                  * init the new one in llog_process_thread_daemonize. */
00664                 lpi->lpi_env = NULL;
00665                 init_completion(&lpi->lpi_completion);
00666                 task = kthread_run(llog_process_thread_daemonize, lpi,
00667                                    "llog_process_thread");
00668                 if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00669                         rc = PTR_ERR(task);
00670                         CERROR("%s: cannot start thread: rc = %d\n",
00671                                loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name, rc);
00672                         GOTO(out_lpi, rc);
00673                 }
00674                 wait_for_completion(&lpi->lpi_completion);
00675         } else {
00676                 lpi->lpi_env = env;
00677                 llog_process_thread(lpi);
00678         }
00679         rc = lpi->lpi_rc;
00680 
00681 out_lpi:
00682         OBD_FREE_PTR(lpi);
00683         RETURN(rc);
00684 }
00685 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_process_or_fork);
00686 
00687 int llog_process(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *loghandle,
00688                  llog_cb_t cb, void *data, void *catdata)
00689 {
00690         int rc;
00691         rc = llog_process_or_fork(env, loghandle, cb, data, catdata, true);
00692         return rc == LLOG_DEL_PLAIN ? 0 : rc;
00693 }
00694 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_process);
00695 
00696 int llog_reverse_process(const struct lu_env *env,
00697                          struct llog_handle *loghandle, llog_cb_t cb,
00698                          void *data, void *catdata)
00699 {
00700         struct llog_log_hdr *llh = loghandle->lgh_hdr;
00701         struct llog_process_cat_data *cd = catdata;
00702         void *buf;
00703         int rc = 0, first_index = 1, index, idx;
00704         __u32   chunk_size = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00705         ENTRY;
00706 
00707         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(buf, chunk_size);
00708         if (buf == NULL)
00709                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00710 
00711         if (cd != NULL)
00712                 first_index = cd->lpcd_first_idx + 1;
00713         if (cd != NULL && cd->lpcd_last_idx)
00714                 index = cd->lpcd_last_idx;
00715         else
00716                 index = LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh) - 1;
00717 
00718         while (rc == 0) {
00719                 struct llog_rec_hdr *rec;
00720                 struct llog_rec_tail *tail;
00721 
00722                 /* skip records not set in bitmap */
00723                 while (index >= first_index &&
00724                        !ext2_test_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh)))
00725                         --index;
00726 
00727                 LASSERT(index >= first_index - 1);
00728                 if (index == first_index - 1)
00729                         break;
00730 
00731                 /* get the buf with our target record; avoid old garbage */
00732                 memset(buf, 0, chunk_size);
00733                 rc = llog_prev_block(env, loghandle, index, buf, chunk_size);
00734                 if (rc)
00735                         GOTO(out, rc);
00736 
00737                 rec = buf;
00738                 idx = rec->lrh_index;
00739                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "index %u : idx %u\n", index, idx);
00740                 while (idx < index) {
00741                         rec = (void *)rec + rec->lrh_len;
00742                         if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(rec))
00743                                 lustre_swab_llog_rec(rec);
00744                         idx ++;
00745                 }
00746                 LASSERT(idx == index);
00747                 tail = (void *)rec + rec->lrh_len - sizeof(*tail);
00748 
00749                 /* process records in buffer, starting where we found one */
00750                 while ((void *)tail > buf) {
00751                         if (tail->lrt_index == 0)
00752                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0); /* no more records */
00753 
00754                         /* if set, process the callback on this record */
00755                         if (ext2_test_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh))) {
00756                                 rec = (void *)tail - tail->lrt_len +
00757                                       sizeof(*tail);
00758 
00759                                 rc = cb(env, loghandle, rec, data);
00760                                 if (rc == LLOG_PROC_BREAK) {
00761                                         GOTO(out, rc);
00762                                 } else if (rc == LLOG_DEL_RECORD) {
00763                                         rc = llog_cancel_rec(env, loghandle,
00764                                                              tail->lrt_index);
00765                                 }
00766                                 if (rc)
00767                                         GOTO(out, rc);
00768                         }
00769 
00770                         /* previous record, still in buffer? */
00771                         --index;
00772                         if (index < first_index)
00773                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00774                         tail = (void *)tail - tail->lrt_len;
00775                 }
00776         }
00777 
00778 out:
00779         if (buf != NULL)
00780                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf, chunk_size);
00781         RETURN(rc);
00782 }
00783 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_reverse_process);
00784 
00799 int llog_exist(struct llog_handle *loghandle)
00800 {
00801         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00802         int                      rc;
00803 
00804         ENTRY;
00805 
00806         rc = llog_handle2ops(loghandle, &lop);
00807         if (rc)
00808                 RETURN(rc);
00809         if (lop->lop_exist == NULL)
00810                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00811 
00812         rc = lop->lop_exist(loghandle);
00813         RETURN(rc);
00814 }
00815 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_exist);
00816 
00817 int llog_declare_create(const struct lu_env *env,
00818                         struct llog_handle *loghandle, struct thandle *th)
00819 {
00820         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00821         int                      raised, rc;
00822 
00823         ENTRY;
00824 
00825         rc = llog_handle2ops(loghandle, &lop);
00826         if (rc)
00827                 RETURN(rc);
00828         if (lop->lop_declare_create == NULL)
00829                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00830 
00831         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00832         if (!raised)
00833                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00834         rc = lop->lop_declare_create(env, loghandle, th);
00835         if (!raised)
00836                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00837         RETURN(rc);
00838 }
00839 
00840 int llog_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,

00844         int                      raised, rc;
00845 
00846         ENTRY;
00847 
00848         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00849         if (rc)
00850                 RETURN(rc);
00851         if (lop->lop_create == NULL)
00852                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00853 
00854         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00855         if (!raised)
00856                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00857         rc = lop->lop_create(env, handle, th);
00858         if (!raised)
00859                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00860         RETURN(rc);
00861 }
00862 
00863 int llog_declare_write_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
00864                            struct llog_handle *handle,
00865                            struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, int idx,
00866                            struct thandle *th)
00867 {
00868         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00869         int                      raised, rc;
00870 
00871         ENTRY;
00872 
00873         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00874         if (rc)
00875                 RETURN(rc);
00876         LASSERT(lop);
00877         if (lop->lop_declare_write_rec == NULL)
00878                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00879 
00880         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00881         if (!raised)
00882                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00883         rc = lop->lop_declare_write_rec(env, handle, rec, idx, th);
00884         if (!raised)
00885                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00886         RETURN(rc);
00887 }
00888 
00889 int llog_write_rec(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,
00890                    struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, struct llog_cookie *logcookies,
00891                    int idx, struct thandle *th)
00892 {
00893         struct llog_operations  *lop;
00894         int                      raised, rc, buflen;
00895 
00896         ENTRY;
00897 
00898         rc = llog_handle2ops(handle, &lop);
00899         if (rc)
00900                 RETURN(rc);
00901 
00902         LASSERT(lop);
00903         if (lop->lop_write_rec == NULL)
00904                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00905 
00906         buflen = rec->lrh_len;
00907         LASSERT(cfs_size_round(buflen) == buflen);
00908 
00909         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00910         if (!raised)
00911                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00912         rc = lop->lop_write_rec(env, handle, rec, logcookies, idx, th);
00913         if (!raised)
00914                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00915         RETURN(rc);
00916 }
00917 
00918 int llog_add(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh,
00919              struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, struct llog_cookie *logcookies,
00920              struct thandle *th)
00921 {
00922         int raised, rc;
00923 
00924         ENTRY;
00925 
00926         if (lgh->lgh_logops->lop_add == NULL)
00927                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00928 
00929         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00930         if (!raised)
00931                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00932         rc = lgh->lgh_logops->lop_add(env, lgh, rec, logcookies, th);
00933         if (!raised)
00934                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00935         RETURN(rc);
00936 }
00937 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_add);
00938 
00939 int llog_declare_add(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *lgh,
00940                      struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, struct thandle *th)
00941 {
00942         int raised, rc;
00943 
00944         ENTRY;
00945 
00946         if (lgh->lgh_logops->lop_declare_add == NULL)
00947                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00948 
00949         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00950         if (!raised)
00951                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00952         rc = lgh->lgh_logops->lop_declare_add(env, lgh, rec, th);
00953         if (!raised)
00954                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
00955         RETURN(rc);
00956 }
00957 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_declare_add);
00958 
00963 int llog_open_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
00964                      struct llog_handle **res, struct llog_logid *logid,
00965                      char *name)
00966 {
00967         struct dt_device        *d;
00968         struct thandle          *th;
00969         int                      rc;
00970 
00971         ENTRY;
00972 
00973         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, res, logid, name, LLOG_OPEN_NEW);
00974         if (rc)
00975                 RETURN(rc);
00976 
00977         if (llog_exist(*res))
00978                 RETURN(0);
00979 
00980         LASSERT((*res)->lgh_obj != NULL);
00981 
00982         d = lu2dt_dev((*res)->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
00983 
00984         th = dt_trans_create(env, d);
00985         if (IS_ERR(th))
00986                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
00987 
00988         /* Create update llog object synchronously, which
00989          * happens during inialization process see
00990          * lod_sub_prep_llog(), to make sure the update
00991          * llog object is created before corss-MDT writing
00992          * updates into the llog object */
00993         if (ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID)
00994                 th->th_sync = 1;
00995 
00996         th->th_wait_submit = 1;
00997         rc = llog_declare_create(env, *res, th);
00998         if (rc == 0) {
00999                 rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, d, th);
01000                 if (rc == 0)
01001                         rc = llog_create(env, *res, th);
01002         }
01003         dt_trans_stop(env, d, th);
01004 out:
01005         if (rc)
01006                 llog_close(env, *res);
01007         RETURN(rc);
01008 }
01009 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_open_create);
01010 
01014 int llog_erase(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
01015                struct llog_logid *logid, char *name)
01016 {
01017         struct llog_handle      *handle;
01018         int                      rc = 0, rc2;
01019 
01020         ENTRY;
01021 
01022         /* nothing to erase */
01023         if (name == NULL && logid == NULL)
01024                 RETURN(0);
01025 
01026         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &handle, logid, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01027         if (rc < 0)
01028                 RETURN(rc);
01029 
01030         rc = llog_init_handle(env, handle, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01031         if (rc == 0)
01032                 rc = llog_destroy(env, handle);
01033 
01034         rc2 = llog_close(env, handle);
01035         if (rc == 0)
01036                 rc = rc2;
01037         RETURN(rc);
01038 }
01039 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_erase);
01040 
01041 /*
01042  * Helper function for write record in llog.
01043  * It hides all transaction handling from caller.
01044  * Valid only with local llog.
01045  */
01046 int llog_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *loghandle,
01047                struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, int idx)
01048 {
01049         struct dt_device        *dt;
01050         struct thandle          *th;
01051         int                      rc;
01052 
01053         ENTRY;
01054 
01055         LASSERT(loghandle);
01056         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_ctxt);
01057         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_obj != NULL);
01058 
01059         dt = lu2dt_dev(loghandle->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
01060 
01061         th = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
01062         if (IS_ERR(th))
01063                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
01064 
01065         rc = llog_declare_write_rec(env, loghandle, rec, idx, th);
01066         if (rc)
01067                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
01068 
01069         th->th_wait_submit = 1;
01070         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, th);
01071         if (rc)
01072                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
01073 
01074         down_write(&loghandle->lgh_lock);
01075         rc = llog_write_rec(env, loghandle, rec, NULL, idx, th);
01076         up_write(&loghandle->lgh_lock);
01077 out_trans:
01078         dt_trans_stop(env, dt, th);
01079         RETURN(rc);
01080 }
01081 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_write);
01082 
01083 int llog_open(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
01084               struct llog_handle **lgh, struct llog_logid *logid,
01085               char *name, enum llog_open_param open_param)
01086 {
01087         int      raised;
01088         int      rc;
01089 
01090         ENTRY;
01091 
01092         LASSERT(ctxt);
01093         LASSERT(ctxt->loc_logops);
01094 
01095         if (ctxt->loc_logops->lop_open == NULL) {
01096                 *lgh = NULL;
01097                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
01098         }
01099 
01100         *lgh = llog_alloc_handle();
01101         if (*lgh == NULL)
01102                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01103         (*lgh)->lgh_ctxt = ctxt;
01104         (*lgh)->lgh_logops = ctxt->loc_logops;
01105 
01106         raised = cfs_cap_raised(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
01107         if (!raised)
01108                 cfs_cap_raise(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
01109         rc = ctxt->loc_logops->lop_open(env, *lgh, logid, name, open_param);
01110         if (!raised)
01111                 cfs_cap_lower(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
01112         if (rc) {
01113                 llog_free_handle(*lgh);
01114                 *lgh = NULL;
01115         }
01116         RETURN(rc);
01117 }
01118 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_open);
01119 
01120 int llog_close(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *loghandle)
01121 {
01122         struct llog_operations  *lop;
01123         int                      rc;
01124 
01125         ENTRY;
01126 
01127         rc = llog_handle2ops(loghandle, &lop);
01128         if (rc)
01129                 GOTO(out, rc);
01130         if (lop->lop_close == NULL)
01131                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOPNOTSUPP);
01132         rc = lop->lop_close(env, loghandle);
01133 out:
01134         llog_handle_put(loghandle);
01135         RETURN(rc);
01136 }
01137 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_close);
01138 
01150 int llog_is_empty(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
01151                   char *name)
01152 {
01153         struct llog_handle      *llh;
01154         int                      rc = 0;
01155 
01156         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01157         if (rc < 0) {
01158                 if (likely(rc == -ENOENT))
01159                         rc = 0;
01160                 GOTO(out, rc);
01161         }
01162 
01163         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01164         if (rc)
01165                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01166         rc = llog_get_size(llh);
01167 
01168 out_close:
01169         llog_close(env, llh);
01170 out:
01171         /* The header is record 1, the llog is still considered as empty
01172          * if there is only header */
01173         return (rc <= 1);
01174 }
01175 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_is_empty);
01176 
01177 int llog_copy_handler(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
01178                       struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
01179 {
01180         struct llog_handle      *copy_llh = data;
01181 
01182         /* Append all records */
01183         return llog_write(env, copy_llh, rec, LLOG_NEXT_IDX);
01184 }
01185 
01186 /* backup plain llog */
01187 int llog_backup(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
01188                 struct llog_ctxt *ctxt, struct llog_ctxt *bctxt,
01189                 char *name, char *backup)
01190 {
01191         struct llog_handle      *llh, *bllh;
01192         int                      rc;
01193 
01194         ENTRY;
01195 
01196         /* open original log */
01197         rc = llog_open(env, ctxt, &llh, NULL, name, LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01198         if (rc < 0) {
01199                 /* the -ENOENT case is also reported to the caller
01200                  * but silently so it should handle that if needed.
01201                  */
01202                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
01203                         CERROR("%s: failed to open log %s: rc = %d\n",
01204                                obd->obd_name, name, rc);
01205                 RETURN(rc);
01206         }
01207 
01208         rc = llog_init_handle(env, llh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01209         if (rc)
01210                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01211 
01212         /* Make sure there's no old backup log */
01213         rc = llog_erase(env, bctxt, NULL, backup);
01214         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
01215                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01216 
01217         /* open backup log */
01218         rc = llog_open_create(env, bctxt, &bllh, NULL, backup);
01219         if (rc) {
01220                 CERROR("%s: failed to open backup logfile %s: rc = %d\n",
01221                        obd->obd_name, backup, rc);
01222                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
01223         }
01224 
01225         /* check that backup llog is not the same object as original one */
01226         if (llh->lgh_obj == bllh->lgh_obj) {
01227                 CERROR("%s: backup llog %s to itself (%s), objects %p/%p\n",
01228                        obd->obd_name, name, backup, llh->lgh_obj,
01229                        bllh->lgh_obj);
01230                 GOTO(out_backup, rc = -EEXIST);
01231         }
01232 
01233         rc = llog_init_handle(env, bllh, LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN, NULL);
01234         if (rc)
01235                 GOTO(out_backup, rc);
01236 
01237         /* Copy log record by record */
01238         rc = llog_process_or_fork(env, llh, llog_copy_handler, (void *)bllh,
01239                                   NULL, false);
01240         if (rc)
01241                 CERROR("%s: failed to backup log %s: rc = %d\n",
01242                        obd->obd_name, name, rc);
01243 out_backup:
01244         llog_close(env, bllh);
01245 out_close:
01246         llog_close(env, llh);
01247         RETURN(rc);
01248 }
01249 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_backup);
01250 
01251 /* Get size of llog */
01252 __u64 llog_size(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh)
01253 {
01254         int rc;
01255         struct lu_attr la;
01256 
01257         rc = llh->lgh_obj->do_ops->do_attr_get(env, llh->lgh_obj, &la);
01258         if (rc) {
01259                 CERROR("%s: attr_get failed, rc = %d\n",
01260                        llh->lgh_ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name, rc);
01261                 return 0;
01262         }
01263 
01264         return la.la_size;
01265 }
01266 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_size);
